website_summaries.verdict: A go-to study guide that project managers can use as a reference long after passing the PMP exam.
pros: Goes beyond the basics to give good insight into the PMI
Well edited with few to no errors in spelling or sample problems
Sample questions are on par with actual exam questions
Plenty of exercises and practice questions
cons: Not a standalone resource, but works well in tandem with other prep resources
Rita’s process chart and guide are confusing and not useful to some

customer_reviews.title: Great foundational study aid.
customer_reviews.text: To study for my PMP exam, I used Rita's PMP Exam Prep in conjunction with referencing the PMBOK and then writings the tests from Christopher Scordo's, Oliver Lehmann's Exam Self-Assessment Test (this is a free web-based timed test and has great resources at the bottom of this webpage as well), and Oliver Lehmann's free 175 Prep Questions. After 3 months of dedicated study, I passed my PMP examination. Rita's text is great as a foundational read and is the only study aid I used that had good Critical Path questions, but it's not an end-all-be-all. Use the other cheap or free aids I mentioned and in my experience, you'll have a great set of tools to prepare for your examination.
customer_reviews.author: Alvais

customer_reviews.title: A life saver!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I'll be honest. You can't just pass the exam by reading this book once. You need utmost dedication to understand the topic really well. I cleared the exam today. I can tell you one thing for sure - this book is a game changer. You've to realize the importance of the questions in the back of every chapter to really master the book AND the exam. I did witness couple of questions directly lifted from this book. The concepts are pretty nicely explained in this book. An thumbs up for the author and the experts involved in preparing this book and continuing the legacy of Rita Mulcahy. Kudos!
customer_reviews.author: Prithvi S.

customer_reviews.title: Thank You, Rita!!
customer_reviews.text: I just passed the PMP exam today on the first try. This book was a lifesaver -- I couldn't have passed without it! When I started to prepare for exam, the material appeared to be overwhelming, but this guide presented the information in organized, easy-to-read, manageable portions. The tips, exercises, and practice exams were extremely helpful in improving my understanding of the material. For anyone studying for the exam, this guide is a must-have. My recommendation is to follow the advice in the book, do all the exercises, and complete the practice exams according to the instructions in the book. Excellent guide!
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Red

customer_reviews.title: this was a fantastic choice!
customer_reviews.text: I was lost as to where to begin studying...I needed a study plan and stumbled across this in my online searches. It arrived on 12/10/2017 and I passed the PMI on my first try on February 18, 2018. I have a kid and a full time job, so I spent whatever spare time I had studying. This book makes the test practical and Her practice tests work for digesting not just memorizing the KC tent. Paired with another test simulator I found online, this was a fantastic choice!

customer_reviews.title: to my great relief it proved enough to pass on my first ...

The test itself is hard, but this is a valuable prep tool that breaks down key concepts in a logical way. Highly recommended.

Between the exercises, practice tests, and in-depth explanation, this book provided not only the chops to pass the exam, but also some practical advice for implementation. I have been doing project and program management for 20 years and I felt that I learned a lot from this. Crushed the exam on the first try.

Notes for overall prep - know the inputs and outputs of each process, know the sequential steps for the planning process, understand risk management well and how it interlaces to each process, and know specific definitions of the techniques described in each section. Good luck!!

Buy this book, study it well and you'll save yourself a lot of trouble up front.
